metadata.Title: CVE-2017-12587 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
ImageMagick 7.0.6-1 has a large loop vulnerability in the ReadPWPImage function in coders\pwp.c.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-12587` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

imagemagick - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.11
imagemagick-6.q16 - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.11
imagemagick-common - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.11
libimage-magick-perl - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.11
libimage-magick-q16-perl - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.11
libmagick++-6-headers - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.11
libmagick++-6.q16-5v5 - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.11
libmagickcore-6-arch-config - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.11
libmagickcore-6-headers - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.11
libmagickcore-6.q16-2 - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.11
libmagickcore-6.q16-2-extra - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.11
libmagickwand-6-headers - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.11
libmagickwand-6.q16-2 - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.11
perlmagick - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.11
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> 0142-Avoid-unbounded-loop-in-pwp-coder.patch in unstable 0098-Avoid-unbounded-loop-in-pwp-coder.patchin stretch 0276-CVE-2017-12587-Fix-large-loop-vulnerability-in-ReadPWPImage.patch in wheezy

criterions.comment: imagemagick package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.11').
